channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Natural gas prices are low, but your monthly gas bill is up. Here's why
item.description: Gas utility bills are rising even though natural gas prices are down. That's because a much larger share of your gas bill now goes to infrastructure i...

item.title: Media companies thought late night TV was irrelevant. Kimmel proved them wrong
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel's return to airwaves might just point the way forward for late night TV to prove its relevance to American audiences — and to itself.

item.title: This wedding photographer now removes landmines for a group that's won a top prize
item.description: The Mines Advisory Group has been removing landmines for more than three decades. This year, it received the Conrad N. Hilton Humanitarian Prize, a pr...

item.title: New York Braces for Potential Flooding and Heavy Winds From Nor’easter
item.description: The storm has been moving up the East Coast since the weekend, dumping heavy rain and flooding roads on its way toward New England.

item.title: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt Share Nobel in Economics
item.description: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt won the prize for showing how “society must keep an eye on the factors that generate and sustain economic...

item.title: Highlighting Indigenous stories from across NPR's network
item.description: NPR is highlighting Indigenous stories from across its network in celebrations of Indigenous Peoples Day.

item.title: Coal Miners With Black Lung Say They Are ‘Cast Aside to Die’ Under Trump
item.description: President Trump has been a cheerleader for coal miners. But these miners say his administration is failing to enforce limits on a lethal workplace haz...

item.title: When I Look at Zohran Mamdani, Here’s What I See
item.description: What does it means to be a “good” Muslim in America?

item.title: Kids who use social media score lower on reading and memory tests, a study shows
item.description: Data from a large, ongoing study of adolescents shows a link between increasing social media use and lower cognition and memory in teens.

item.title: Macron Urges Stability Despite Calls for Government Ouster in France

item.title: The Release of Israeli Hostages and Palestinian Prisoners in Photos and Videos
item.description: Twenty living hostages were freed by Hamas on Monday under the cease-fire deal, and Israel released nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners.

item.title: More Than 40 People Killed in Bus Crash in South Africa
item.description: The bus was carrying passengers from Zimbabwe and Malawi who were traveling back to their home countries.
